{
  "Allegations" : "ON 6/29/2005, [CUSTOMER] PURCHASED A VARIABLE ANNUITY WITH AN INITIAL PREMIUM OF $96,000 OF NON-QUALIFIED FUNDS AND NEEDED MONTHLY INCOME THROUGH A 72-Q. RAY SAKAI, THE FINANCIAL ADVISOR SET UP THE 72-Q ALONG WITH AN INCOME RIDER ON THE VARIABLE ANNUITY PRODUCT. [CUSTOMER] HAD TO TAKE INCOME FROM THE VARIABLE ANNUITY UNTIL SHE TURNED 591/2 UNDER THE 72-Q PROVISIONS. [CUSTOMER] MISUNDERSTOOD THE 72-Q ILLUSTRATION THE ADVISOR RAN FOR HER IN 2005 AND THOUGHT THAN WHEN SHE TURNED 591/2 SHE WOULD RECEIVE $83,240.00 BACK FROM THE CONTRACT EVEN THOUGH SHE HAD BEEN TAKING MONTHLY PAYMENTS FROM THE CONTRACT OF $500.00 FOR OVER SEVEN YEARS. DUE TO [CUSTOMER'S] MISUNDERSTANDING OF THE 72-Q HYPOTHETICAL WE PAID HER AN ACCOMMODATION VALUED AT $18,797.00 WHICH ENSURED THAT IN OCTOBER 2012 WHEN SHE TURNS 591/2 THAT SHE IS ABLE TO LEAVE THE VARIABLE ANNUITY CONTRACT WITH $83,240.00.",
  "Damage Amount Requested" : "$18,797.00",
  "Settlement Amount" : "$18,797.00",
  "DisplayAAOLinkIfExists" : "N",
  "arbitrationClaimFiledDetail" : "",
  "arbitrationDocketNumber" : "",
  "Broker Comment" : "WESCOM FINANCIAL SERVICES PROVIDED AN ACCOMMODATION PAYMENT IN THE AMOUNT OF $18,797.00 BECAUSE [CUSTOMER] MISUNDERSTOOD THE 72-Q HYPOTHETICAL ILLUSTRATION THE FINANCIAL ADVISOR RAN FOR HER IN 2005."
}

{
  "Allegations" : "CLIENT ALLEGED THAT GUARANTEED DEATH BENEFIT AND LIVING BENEFIT RIDERS WERE MISREPRESENTED AS INSURANCE AGAINST MARKET LOSS ON VARIABLE ANNUITY SALE 12/13/1999. AFTER AN INTERNAL INVESTIGATION, FOUND THAT REPRESENTATIVE FAILED TO COMPLETE ANNUITY PAPERWORK CORRECTLY BY OMITTING RIDERS. INSURANCE COMPANY ADDED RIDERS. CLIENT RECEIVED $7,500.00 IN RESTITUTION. INVESTIGATION HAS BEEN CLOSED. SEE COMMENT BELOW.",
  "Damage Amount Requested" : "$15,000.00",
  "Settlement Amount" : "$7,500.00",
  "DisplayAAOLinkIfExists" : "N",
  "arbitrationClaimFiledDetail" : "",
  "arbitrationDocketNumber" : "",
  "Broker Comment" : "THE COMPLAINT WAS SETTLED IN THE FOLLOWING MANNER: 1)CUSTOMER RECEIVED A CHECK FOR $7,500.00 FROM LOCKHEED FEDERAL CREDIT UNION (LFCU) RELATED TO THE TAX CONSEQUENCE; 2)MR. SAKAI CONTRIBUTED APPROXIMATELY $7,500.00 TOWARDS THE SETTLEMENT; AND 3)GLENBROOK CORRECTED THE MISSING RIDERS TO THE CONTRACT AT NO COST TO THE CLIENT. GLENBROOK AND LFCU JOINTLY COVERED 100% OF THE ESTIMATED ACTUARIAL COST FOR THE RIDERS DUE TO THE MARKET LOSS FROM THE INCEPTION DATE OF THE POLICY. BECAUSE THE CLIENT'S CONTRACT WAS MODIFIED AND THE CLIENT RECEIVED NO MONETARY GAIN, ONLY CONTRACTUAL CHANGES THAT INCREASED POTENTIAL CONTRACTUAL BENEFITS, LFCU HAS BEEN ADVISED BY LEGAL COUNSEL AND GLENBROOK'S COMPLIANCE DEPARTMENT THAT THEY BELIEVE THE INTERNAL ACCOUNTING THAT OCCURRED TO CORRECT THE RIDERS WAS NOT AN NASD REPORTABLE EVENT."
